title: Unexpected city itineraries: American food in Cape Town
text:

Fried chicken, grits, chicken and waffles and traditional diners, the Mother City seems to have a soft spot for the great 'Merican' cuisine.

Surprised I haven't seen an all-ocra or better yet, a fried candy bar offering anywhere.

READ: Do not hesitate to go see the new William Kentridge exhibition in Cape Town

Here are some of the best American food spots in the city:

This is the 50s diner experience you want to have. Chow down on traditional burgers and shakes by the counter or sitting in a red booth.

This Mother City dive-bar has just revamped its menu, and it's better than ever. From a Spicy Southern Fried Chicken Burger to Chicken and Waffles, eating here is a big, big, big, pleasure.

City Guide: Why Observatory is the obvious choice for Cape Town's alternative crowd

A modern take on a diner, it serves fresh juices, all day breakfasts, sandwiches, brunch, oysters, dinner and excellent cocktails. Best of all is their cheeseburger with the brioche bun. Heaven for butter and meat lovers. Hell for vegans.

Now much more polished than when it opened a few years ago, it still has an industrial feel and served up monster burgers and delectable American-style pizza.
